intro: Aster yomena var. yomena, commonly known as the Japanese aster, is a perennial flowering plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the cultivar. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
